page.title: 02Grampound School
page.content: I normally get out of bed at 7.00a.m. eager to get to school. I usually leave the house at 8.25 and on the way to school stop to buy sweets at the village shop. Before school starts I like to watch the boys play cricket. The Headmistress rings the bell at 9.00 then we walk round the outside of the school and come in through the porch door. As you walk through the door into the classroom you see seven tables. We have lockers instead of a desk. We have a table which can take eight people and we have a locker of our own to store all our equipment in. The first lesson we usually do is Maths. We follow the Fletcher Maths scheme. At 10.30 a welcome break for playtime. There are only two classes in our school which is lovely as we get to know the teachers very well.
